title: Optimized Information Extraction Design Utilizing Large Language Models

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented classes using digital devices (tablets/laptops), with team project-based learning

learning_goals: Learners can design models optimized for three or more information extraction (IE) tasks by applying Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT) techniques
Learners implement an answer selection algorithm that improves structured vs. natural language output mismatches by over 20%
Learners build an information extraction pipeline achieving F1-scores of 0.85 or higher across five or more public datasets
Learners can train models using computational resources reduced by over 50% compared to conventional fine-tuning
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
